hero.title: Foundation Spiritual Dimension of Europe
hero.body1: The Foundation Spiritual Dimension of Europe has been active since 2008, combining thinking, sensitivity and real action. We believe that Europe is a community of conscience — built on the dignity of the human person and responsibility for others.
hero.body2: Today we focus on helping victims of the war in Ukraine and on supporting political prisoners in Russia and Belarus. The war has maimed hundreds of thousands of people — the needs are enormous and long-term: wheelchairs, prosthetics, rehabilitation, medicines.
hero.body4: But it requires sustained financial support.
hero.body5: The Foundation is not a political institution. It is a space of responsibility — a place where words meet action.
hero.body6: Join us. Support those who need it most.

aboutProject.heading: About the project
aboutProject.body:
The authors of the "Book of Cosmological Interviews" remain anonymous.
They are a group of spiritually independent people from Eastern Europe — from Russia and
Belarus — who for personal, political and moral reasons cannot
appear under their own names. Their anonymity is not a gesture
of concealment or a literary strategy, but a form of protection: the condition that allows
the word to remain free, honest and accountable to the reality in
which it arose.

The authors approached the Foundation Spiritual Dimension of Europe with a request for editorial
care over this book, recognising that this Foundation — operating
continuously since 2008 — is a space capable of bearing both its
intellectual meaning and ethical weight. For many years the Foundation supported
young people in the countries of the former Eastern Bloc, including in Russia, Ukraine and
Belarus, helping with access to education, communication tools and
personal development.

Today, in the face of war, repression and mass violations of human rights, the mission
of the Foundation has been expanded.
The proceeds from the publication of this book are intended to help victims of war in
Ukraine — for the purchase of wheelchairs, prosthetics, medicines, funding
rehabilitation and direct support of wounded, maimed and
orphaned people.

The war in Ukraine has maimed not thousands or tens of thousands of people, but hundreds
of thousands of human lives — across the entire territory of the country. These are people deprived of
limbs, health, homes, the ability to work and a basic sense of
security. They are children, adults and elderly people whose lives have been
permanently marked by violence. The scale of suffering exceeds imagination and
the capacity for emergency humanitarian aid. The needs are enormous, long-term
and very concrete — and without real, strong financial support they will remain
unmet.

Help is possible.
But without decisive financial commitment — it will remain
insufficient.

The Foundation Spiritual Dimension of Europe acts in the conviction that conscience and
solidarity are stronger than violence, and that words — if honest — can become
a form of real action. It is not a political institution. It is a space
of responsibility: a place where thinking, sensitivity and concrete
help meet without the mediation of ideology.

For the authors of this book and for the Foundation, a particular inspiration are people who
did not bend under the pressure of systems of repression — such as Maria Ponomarenko,
Yuriy Dmitriev in Russia and Andrzej Poczobut in Belarus, and thousands
of other prisoners of conscience in Russia and Belarus. Their courage, faithfulness to truth
and willingness to pay a personal price became a symbol of resilience and
spiritual resistance to violence and lies.

The authors of this book and members of the Foundation call for the release of all
political prisoners and prisoners of conscience in Russia and Belarus — people
held in prisons and penal colonies solely for words,
views, opposition to the war, the defense of human dignity and the right to truth.
This appeal is not a political gesture. It is an act of conscience.

We address the readers of this book — to people from the world
of culture, science, media, business and public life — with a request not to
remain indifferent. Every voice, every question put to politicians, every
publication, every public reminder of the names of prisoners of conscience and
every form of pressure on those who have influence, can contribute to real
change in human destinies. Silence is not neutral. Indifference is not
safe.

In the past, members of the Foundation themselves experienced repression and were political
prisoners. They know what silence forced by violence is, what
loneliness in the face of injustice is, and what price a word spoken

against fear has. That is why today they also speak on behalf of those who cannot speak.

This book is not just a record of conversations about the world.
It is also a call not to withdraw from responsibility
in the world we know.

The authors remain anonymous.

founders.heading: Founders and collaborators
founders.subtitle: People who created and supported the Foundation Spiritual Dimension of Europe from the very beginning of its activity.
founders.people.krzysztof_fraczak: Founder and president of the Foundation SPIRITUAL DIMENSION OF EUROPE. Former opposition activist and political prisoner. Publisher of books and periodicals during communism.
founders.people.arkadiusz_rybicki: Former opposition activist and political prisoner. Died on 10 April 2010 in the air crash near Smolensk along with President of Poland Lech Kaczynski.
founders.people.jerzy_borowczak: Former opposition activist and political prisoner.
founders.people.leszek_juchniewicz: Former opposition activist. Donated money for the development of the foundation.
